text: When I'm working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I think only how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong
author: Bucky Fuller

text: organizations which design systems ... are constrained to produce designs which are copies of the communication structures of these organizations.
author: Conway's Law

text: In god we trust; all others must bring data
author: W. Edwards Deming

text: Everybody in this country should learn to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think
author: Steve Jobs

text: Simple, not easy
author: Dean Lister

text: Those who will not risk cannot win
author: John Paul Jones

text: He who has a Why to live for can bear almost any How
author: Nietzsche

text: Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the face
author: Mike Tyson

text: For each desired change, make the change easy (warning: this may be hard), then make the easy change
author: Kent Beck

text: Forces beyond our control can take away everything you possess except one thing, your freedom to choose how to respond to the situation.
author: Harold s Kushner

text: Good design is obvious. Great design is transparent.
author: Joe Sperano

text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: You can't build a reputation on what you're going to do
author: Henry Ford

text: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, but wiser people are so full of doubts.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of a million is a statistic.
author: Joseph Stalin

text: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one thing that heralds new discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but "That's funny...
author: Isaac Asimov

text: the genesis of great companies is answering simple questions that change the world, not the desire to become rich
author: Guy Kawasaki

text: The first follower is what turns a lone nut into a leader
author: Derek Sivers

text: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.
author: Reid Hoffman

text: Do not pray for an easy life; pray for the strength to endure a difficult one
author: Bruce lee

text: Good people accept accountability. Great people ask for it.
author: Guy Kawasaki

text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes
author: Oscar wilde

text: Socialism never took root in America because the poor see themselves as not as an exploited proletariat but as temporarily embarrassed millionaires.
author: John Steinbeck

text: No hables Al menos que puedas mejorar el silencio (don't speak unless you can improve on the silence)
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: winning isn't everything, but the will to prepare to win is everything.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: fool me once, shame on you. fool me twice, strike three
author: Michael Scott

text: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
author: TS Eliot

text: there is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all
author: Peter Drucker

text: if I'd listened to customers I would have given them a faster horse
author: Henry Ford

text: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education
author: Mark Twain

text: it's easier to invent the future than to predict it
author: Alan Kay

text: point if view is worth 80 iq points
author: Alan Kay

text: the days are long but the decades are short
author: Sam Altman

text: you don't feel 30% smarter when the stock price goes up by 30%, so when the stock price goes down, you shouldn't feel 30% dumber
author: Jeff Bezos

text: in the short term the stock market is a voting machine. in the long term it's a weighing machine.
author: Benjamin Graham

text: Assigning single factor causation to the output of complex adaptive system is a triumph of hope over experience
author: Tren Griffen

text: We all too often have socialism for the rich and rugged free market capitalism for the poor.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Every day you survive your life expectancy increases by 5 or 6 hours
author: Peter thiel

text: Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it ... he who doesn't ... pays it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated
author: Confucius

text: There are two kinds of companies, those that work to try to charge more and those that work to charge less. We will be the second.
author: Jeff Bezos

text: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now
author: Chinese proverb

text: You can never get enough of what you don’t really need.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: When the wrong man uses the right means, the right means work in the wrong way
author: Taoist Text

text: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

text: It’s from the champions of the impossible, rather than from slaves of the possible, that evolution draws its creative force
author: Barbara Wootton

text: A society grows great when old men plant trees in whose shade they shall never sit
author: Greek Proverb

text: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
author: Bruce Lee

text:
You never change things by fighting the existing reality.
To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.
author: Bucky Fuller

text: Nothing vast enters the life of mortals without a curse.
author: Sophocles

text: You can create good experiences without knowing the content. What you can’t do is create good experiences without knowing your content structure. What is your content made from, not what your content is.
author: Mark Boulton

text: Our intelligence is what makes us human, and AI is an extension of that quality
author: Yann LeCun

text: Any AI smart enough to pass a Turing test is smart enough to fail it
author: Ian MacDonald

text: if I have seen further than others it is by standing on the shoulders of giants
author: Isaac Newton

text: What I cannot create, I do not understand
author: Richard Feynman

text: We all have two lives, the second one starts when you realise you only have one
author: Confucious

text: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless but planning is indispensable
author: Dwight D Eisenhower

text: All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.
author: Nassim Taleb

text: If revolution there is to be, let us rather undertake it not undergo it
author: Otto von Bismarck

text: Nothing is as powerful as an idea whose time has come
author: Victor Hugo

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C Clarke

text:
Intelligence looks in the mirror and sees ignorance. 
Ignorance looks in the mirror it sees intelligence.
author: @TheTweetOfGod

text: Being rich is having money; being wealthy is having time
author: Margaret Bonnano

text: A civilization which leaves so large a number of its participants unsatisfied and drives them into revolt neither has nor deserves the prospect of a lasting existence.
author: Signumnd Freud

text: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear
author: rumi

text: it is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewery or the baker, that we expect our dinner, but from  their regard to their own interest
author: Adam Smith

text: only the paranoid survive
author: Andy Grove

text: as a species we are easier to fool than convince we've been fooled
author: Scott Galloway

text: Rather than love, than money, than fame, than fairness, give me truth
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful
author: Warren Buffet

text: The thing that I often ask startups on top of Ethereum is, 'Can you please tell me why using the Ethereum blockchain is better than using Excel?' And if they can come up with a good answer, that's when you know you've got something really interesting.
author: Vitalik Buterin

text: people don't have ideas. ideas have people.
author: Carl Jung

text: Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The Winds Of Change Blow, Some People Build Walls, Others Build Windmills
author: Chinese proverb

text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

text: There are decades where nothing happens; and there are weeks where decades happen.
author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin

text: what can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: The more you let a single belief define you, the less capable you are of adapting when life challenges you.
author: James Clear

text: It ain’t what you don’t know that gets you into trouble.It’s what you know for sure that just ain’t so.
author: Mark Twain

text: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text:
Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.

This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children...

This is not a way of life at all, in any true sense. Under the cloud of threatening war, it is humanity hanging from a cross of iron.
author: Dwight D Eisenhower

text: A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

text: A sick man only wants one thing, a healthy man wants 10,000 things.
author: Confucius

text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world
author: Archimedes
Elanor Roosevelt

text: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.
author: John von Neumann

text: I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should have.
author: Leonardo davinci

text: we are now gods but for the wisdom
author: Eric Weinstein

text: opportunities multiply as they are seized
author: sun tzu

text: own assets or sell time
author: jack butcher

text: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
author: G. K. Chesterton+

text: experts teach themselves
author: Paul Graham

text: Amateurs talk strategy. Professionals talk logistics.
author: General Omar Bradley

text: innovation is the child of freedom and the parent of prosperity
author: Naval Ravikant

text: There is only one boss—the customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.
author: Sam Walton

text: Men are thrifty in guarding their private property, but as soon as it comes to wasting time, they are most extravagant with the one commodity for which it's respectable to be greedy
author: Seneca

text: He who knows only his own side of the case knows little of that.
author: John Stuart Mill

text: With my family, I’m a communist. With my close friends, I’m a socialist. At the state level of politics, I’m a Democrat. At higher levels, I’m a Republican, and at the federal levels, I’m a Libertarian.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often
author: Winston Churchill

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change
author: Einstein

text: Words should be weighed, not counted
author: Yiddish Proverb

text: You may not be interested in war, but war is interested in you.
author: Leon Trotsky

text: There are no solutions. There are only trade-offs
author: Thomas Sowell

text: I love it when someone insults me. That means that I don't have to be nice anymore.
author: Billy Idol

text: The test of a first-rate intellect is the ability to hold two opposing ideas in your head at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Art is how we decorate space, music is how we decorate time.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

text: Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!
author: Hunter S Thompson

text: No one ever made a decision because of a number. They need a story.
author: Daniel Kahneman

text: “If one proves the equality of two numbers a and b by showing first that a ≤ b and then that  a ≥ b, it is unfair; one should instead show that they are really equal by disclosing the inner ground for their equality.”
author: Emmy Noether

text: The society that separates its scholars from its warriors will have its thinking done by cowards and its fighting by fools
author: Thucydides

text: When one teaches, two learn.
author: Robert Heinlein

text: The most dangerous worldview is the worldview of those who have not viewed the world.
author: Alexander von Humboldt

text: Normal is an illusion. What is normal for the spider is chaos for the fly.
author: Charles Addams

text: Never, ever, think about something else when you should be thinking about the power of incentives.
author: Charlie Munger

text: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.
author: Salvador Dali Tags

text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: Stress primarily comes from not taking action over something that you can have some control over… stress comes from ignoring things that you shouldn’t be ignoring.
author: Jeff Bezos

text: Most geniuses—especially those who lead others—prosper not by deconstructing intricate complexities but by exploiting unrecognized simplicities.
author: Andy Benoit

text: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.
author: Jack Kerouac

text:
Grandson: "A fight is going on inside me. It is a terrible fight and it is between two wolves. One is evil. The other is good. Which wolf will win?” 
Old Cherokee: "The one you feed.
author: Native American parable

text: Only a few know, how much one must know to know how little one knows.
author: Werner Heisenberg

text: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
author: Heraclitus

text: Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it.
author: Upton Sinclair

text: The future is already here — it's just not very evenly distributed.
author: William Gibson

text: No man for any considerable period can wear one face to himself, and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne, The Scarlet Letter, 1850

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The more laws, the less justice.
author: Cicero

text: The Graveyards Are Full of Indispensable Men
author: Charles De Gaulle

text: The Net interprets censorship as damage and routes around it
author: John Gilmore

text: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

text: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate himself by conscious endeavor.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: in history as in nature, birth and death are equally balanced
author: John Huizinga

text: Scared money don't make money

The universe rewards us for understanding it and punishes us for not understanding it. When we understand the universe, our plans work and we feel good. Conversely, if we try to fly by jumping off a cliff and flapping our arms the universe will kill us.
author: Jack Cohen & Ian Stewart

text: Amateurs talk about strategy and tactics. Professionals talk about logistics and sustainability in warfare.
author: Robert Hilliard Barrow

text: If freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
author: George Washington, March 15, 1783

text: Some birds are not meant to be caged, that's all. Their feathers are too bright, their songs too sweet and wild. So you let them go, or when you open the cage to feed them they somehow fly out past you. And the part of you that knows it was wrong to imprison them in the first place rejoices, but still, the place where you live is that much more drab and empty for their departure.
author: Stephen King

text: It is a very wise thing to simulate craziness at the right time.
author: Machiavelli

text: I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
author: Isaac Newton

text: As our circle of knowledge expands, so does the circumference of darkness surrounding it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Every election is an advanced auction on stolen goods
author: H.L. Mencken

text: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
author: Marie Curie

text: science advance one funeral at a time
author: Max Planck

text: No one loves the warrior until the enemy is at the gate
that in order to make a man/woman covet a thing, it is only necessary to make the thing difficult to attain.
author: Mark Twain

text: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety »
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
author: Wilhelm Stekel. Quoted J. D. Salinger, Catcher in the Rye 1951

text: “If you are depressed you are living in the past. If you are anxious you are living in the future. If you are at peace you are living in the present.” - Lao Tzu
The most incomprehensible thing about the universe is that it is comprehensible
author: Albert einstein

text: It's not that I'm so smart. It's just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

text: No man chooses evil because it is evil. He only mistakes it for happiness.
author: Mary Shelley

text: The clock, not the steam-engine, is the key-machine of the modern indus­trial age.
author: Lewis Mumford

text: If you have an apple and I have an apple, and we swap apples — we each end up with only one apple. But if you and I have an idea and we swap ideas — we each end up with two ideas.
author: Charles F. Brannan (1949)
